RTCRtpEncodingParametersMaxFramerate.summary: The maxFramerate property of the dictionary specifies the maximum framerate that can be used to send the encoding, in frames per second.

remarks.para: The user agent is free to allocate bandwidth between the encodings, as long as the maxFramerate value is not exceeded.

The frame rate is a positive real number ( and will throw a {{jsxref("RangeError")}} exception if the value is less than 0.0).
Setting the maximum frame rate to zero using has the effect of freezing the video on the next frame.

RTCRtpEncodingParametersMaxFramerate.value: A positive real number indicating the maximum frame rate for the specified encoding, in frames per second.
